newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Spokesman says no chemotherapy for Mobutu.
newsitem.headline: Spokesman says no chemotherapy for Mobutu.

text.p: Zaire's president, convalescing after prostate surgery in Switzerland, does not need chemotherapy treatment, his spokesman said.
Kabuya Lumuna told state television on Tuesday night that 66-year-old President Mobutu Sese Seko was convalescing normally and his doctors were satisfied with his progress.

"Reports concerning chemotherapy with harmful side effects are without foundation," Kabuya told the nation, denying a Swiss television report suggesting Mobutu would have chemotherapy treatment until the end of the year.
"The report of the personal doctor of the head of state shows that his convalescence is continuing normally to the satisfaction of the doctors treating him," he said.
A cloak of secrecy surrounds Mobutu in Switzerland.
Since undergoing surgery for prostate cancer on August 22 at Lausanne's University Hospital, he has been staying with his entourage at the Beau-Rivage Palace hotel, one of the world's most exclusive.
Witnesses report rare sightings at gourmet restaurants in Lausanne and at the University Hospital.
Reports on Mobutu's health within Zaire most often take the form of denials of foreign reports. One newspaper was banned from publishing after saying Mobutu was riddled with cancer.
Opposition newspapers have highlighted differences between the reports from Europe and those broadcast within Zaire.
"On Fieldmarshall Mobutu's illness, domestic news continues to contradict reports from our European colleagues," one opposition newspaper, La Reference, said on Wednesday.
